name: Dummy Deck
description: Sandbox for testing new technical phrases before migration.

cards.sideA: Esa biblioteca permite forzar la actualización.

sideB.text: That library allows forcing the update.
That library enables us to force an update.
That library makes it possible to force the update.

cards.note:
**[13]**



~That library allows to force~ is grammatically incorrect. The verb 'allow' must be followed by an Object + Infinitive ([allows us to force]) or a Gerund ([allows forcing]). It cannot be followed directly by 'to'.

~That library allows forcing the updating~ is unnatural. Use the noun [update] instead of the gerund 'updating' when referring to the specific event/action.

cards.sideA: Envía todos los datos solo en 1 llamada.

sideB.text: It sends all the data in a single call.
It transmits all the information in just one call.
All data is sent using only one request.
It sends all the data in just one call.
It sends all the data in just a single call.

cards.note:
~It sends all the data just in one call~ sounds unnatural. The adverb 'just' should modify the quantity 'one', so the correct order is [in just one call].

~It sends all the data just in a single call~ is slightly awkward. The adverb 'just' should be placed right before the quantity it emphasizes: [in just a single call].

cards.sideA: Al ser un procedimiento público, necesitamos establecerlo de esa manera.

sideB.text: Since it's a public procedure, we need to set it that way.
As it is a public procedure, it must be established accordingly.
Because the procedure is public, we have to define it as such.
As a public procedure, we need to set it that way.

cards.note: ~For being a public procedure~ is incorrect. Use [Since it is] or [Because it is] to express cause.

cards.sideA: Si ninguna condición se cumple, retornamos ese valor.

sideB.text: If no conditions are met, we return that value.
We return that value as a fallback if no condition is satisfied.
In the event that no conditions match, we return that specific value.
If none of the conditions are met, we return that value.

cards.note:
**[190]**

~If none conditions are met~ is incorrect because 'none' is a pronoun. Use the determiner [no] before the noun 'conditions'.

~If any conditions are met, we return that value~ is incorrect because it changes the meaning to the opposite of the original sentence. To express that zero conditions were satisfied, use [no conditions] or [none of the conditions].

cards.sideA: Ahora el dropdown de cantidad, es igual que en el catálogo.

sideB.text: Now the quantity dropdown is the same as in the catalog.
The quantity dropdown now matches the one in the catalog.
We have aligned the quantity dropdown with the catalog version.
Now the quantity dropdown is equal to the catalog.
Now the quantity dropdown is equal to the one in the catalog.

cards.sideA: Ahora el catalogo, cart y return items funcionan igual en sus cantidades.

sideB.text: Now the catalog, cart, and return items work the same regarding quantities.
Catalog, cart, and return items now share the same quantity logic.
Quantities now function consistently across the catalog, cart, and return items.
Now the catalog, cart, and return items work identically in their quantities.
Now the catalog, cart, and return items work in the same way regarding quantities.
Now the catalog, cart, and return items work with the same quantity logic.
Now the catalog, cart, and return items work the same regarding their quantities.

cards.note:
**[191]**

~Now the catalog, cart, and return items work the same as their quantities~ is incorrect because 'as their quantities' implies a comparison between the items and the quantities themselves. Use [regarding] or [in terms of] to specify the category of comparison.

~...work the same in their quantities~ is not idiomatic. Use [regarding] or [in terms of] quantities. 

~...work equal to...~ is incorrect. 'Equal to' implies value comparison. Use [the same way] for functionality.

cards.sideA: En la sección de la lupa no estábamos usando correctamente el profile.

sideB.text: In the search section, we weren't using the profile correctly.
We weren't correctly utilizing the profile within the magnifying glass area.
The profile was not being applied properly in the search functionality.
In the magnifying glass section, we weren't using the right profile.

cards.note: ~We hadn't used...~ uses the Past Perfect tense. The Spanish sentence uses the Past Continuous ("no estábamos usando"), so the correct translation is [We were not using...].

cards.sideA: Este cambio es para manejar correctamente la unión de líneas en el carrito.

sideB.text: This change is to correctly handle the merging of cart lines.
This modification ensures cart lines are merged properly.
We implemented this to manage cart line merging according to business rules.
This change is to correctly handle the merge in cart lines.
This change is to correctly handle the merging lines in the cart.

cards.sideA: Usamos el parámetro p_combinesameitem para controlar si se agrupan los items.

sideB.text: We use the p_combinesameitem parameter to control item grouping.
The p_combinesameitem flag is used to manage whether items are combined.
We're utilizing the p_combinesameitem parameter to determine if same items should merge.
We use the p_combinesameitem parameter to control merged items.
We use the p_combinesameitem parameter to control if items are merged.

cards.sideA: El cambio afecta tanto a la creación como a la actualización del carrito.

sideB.text: The change affects both the creation and update of the cart.
This modification impacts procedures for adding items and creating quotes.
We've updated the logic within both the creation and addition procedures.
The change affects creation and cart update.

cards.note:
**[52]**



~The change affects to the creation...~ is incorrect because the verb 'affect' is transitive and does not use the preposition 'to'. You should say [The change affects the creation...].

cards.sideA: Antes se enviaba todo por el uso de *, ahora solo lo que necesitamos.

sideB.text: Before, everything was sent using *, now only what we need.
Previously, the * was used to send everything; now we only send necessary data.
We used to send everything via *, but now we only include what's required.

cards.note:
**[113]**



~Before, everything was sent for the use of *~ is incorrect because 'for the use of' is a literal translation that sounds unnatural here. Use [using] or [via] to describe the method.

cards.sideA: Fue un cambio mayor el que hicimos.

sideB.text: It was a major change that we made.
We implemented a significant change.
The modification we performed was a major one.
What we made was a major change.
What we did was a major change.

cards.note:
**[63]**

~What we made It was a major change~ is incorrect because 'It' is redundant. Use the noun clause [What we made was a major change].

cards.sideA: En esta release, no hubo actualizacion de la especificacion.

sideB.text: In this release, there was no update to the specification.
There was no spec update for this release.
The specification was not updated in this release.
In this release, there was no update of the specification.
In this release, there wasn't any update to the specification.

cards.note:
**[192]**

~there was no update in the specification~ is less natural. The standard preposition for updates made to a document or system is [to] (e.g., an update to the policy).

cards.sideA: Refactorizamos el código para extraer la lógica de sesión en una función independiente.

sideB.text: We refactored the code to extract the session logic into a separate function.
The code was refactored to pull the session logic into an independent function.
We've refactored to move the session logic to its own function.

cards.note:
~We refactorized~ is not a valid verb. Use [refactored].

~...extract the session logic in a separate function~ is incorrect. When describing moving or transforming something into a new container or state, use the preposition [into].

cards.sideA: Separamos la obtención de la sesión de la inicialización del entorno.

sideB.text: We separated session retrieval from environment initialization.
Session fetching has been decoupled from the environment setup.
We split getting the session from initializing the environment.
We separated the retrieval of the session from environment initialization.

cards.note: ~We separated session retrieving...~ is less natural. Use the noun phrase [session retrieval] to parallel 'initialization'.

cards.sideA: ¿Esta la VPN con errores?

sideB.text: Is the VPN experiencing errors?
Are there issues with the VPN?
Is the VPN having some errors?

cards.note:
~Is the VPN with errors?~ and ~Is the VPN with down?~ are invalid. Use [Is the VPN down?] or [Are there errors with the VPN?].

~Is the VPN with errors?~ implies the VPN is carrying errors like an accessory. In English, we use the verb 'have' for possession of problems ([Does the VPN have errors?]) or 'be' for the state ([Is the VPN down?]).

cards.sideA: Vamos a ensayar la instalacion completa.

sideB.text: We are going to do a dry run of the full installation.
We're going to rehearse the full install.
We'll run a smoke test for the complete installation.
We are going to test the complete installation.
We are going to test the entire installation.

cards.sideA: Entran todos en el resultado de la query.

sideB.text: All of them are included in the query result.
Everything is contained within the query output.
Every single one is returned by the query.
Everything is included in the query result.
All are included in the query result.
They are all included in the query result.

cards.sideA: En el Miércoles se hizo eso.

sideB.text: That was done on Wednesday.
It happened on Wednesday.
On Wednesday, that task was finished.
That was made on Wednesday.

cards.sideA: Este está relacionado con los que estábamos viendo un momento atrás.

sideB.text: This is related to the ones we were looking at a moment ago.
This one relates to the ones we were seeing just a moment ago.
This is connected to the ones we were viewing a moment back.
This is related to the ones we were looking at before.

cards.sideA: Esto está relacionado con los que estábamos viendo antes.

sideB.text: This is related to the ones we were looking at before.
This relates to what we were seeing earlier.
This is connected to the ones we were viewing before.

cards.sideA: No hubieron actualizaciones en la especificación.

sideB.text: There were no updates to the specification.
There weren't any updates in the spec.
No updates were made to the specification.
There were no updates in the specification.

cards.sideA: No hubo ninguna modificación en la especificación.

sideB.text: There wasn't any modification to the specification.
There was no modification in the spec.
No modification was made to the specification.
There wasn't any modification in the specification.

cards.sideA: Hubieron algunas modificaciones en la especificación.

sideB.text: There were some modifications to the specification.
Some modifications were made to the spec.
There have been a few modifications in the specification.
There were some modifications in the specification.

cards.sideA: Sí, como siempre.

sideB.text: Yes, as always.
Yeah, as usual.
Yes, just like always.

cards.sideA: Asi es, como siempre.

sideB.text: That's right, as always.
That is correct, as usual.
It is so, as always.
That's it, as always.

cards.sideA: El output actual es idéntico al esperado.

sideB.text: The current output is identical to the expected one.
The current output is the same as the expected one.
The actual output is identical to what was expected.

cards.note:
**[191]**

Use [Identical to] or [Same as] for structural matches.

cards.sideA: Si el input es igual a cero, lanza un error.

sideB.text: If the input is equal to zero, throw an error.
If the input equals zero, throw an error.
Should the input be equal to zero, throw an error.

cards.note:
**[191]**

For mathematical values, use [Equal to].

cards.sideA: Ambos servidores son iguales en términos de capacidad.

sideB.text: Both servers are equal in terms of capacity.
Both servers are the same regarding capacity.
Both servers are identical in terms of capacity.

cards.note:
**[191]**

Use [In terms of] or [Regarding] to limit the comparison to a specific attribute.

cards.sideA: No estábamos usándolo correctamente.

sideB.text: We weren't using it correctly.
We were not using it properly.
We were using it incorrectly.

cards.sideA: Estábamos equivocados haciéndolo de esa forma.

sideB.text: We were wrong doing it that way.
We were mistaken doing it like that.
We were wrong to do it that way.

cards.sideA: Refactorizamos el código para mejor mantenibilidad principalmente.

sideB.text: We refactored the code mainly for better maintainability.
We refactored the code primarily to improve maintainability.
Mainly for better maintainability, we refactored the code.
We refactored the code for better maintainability mainly.
We refactored the code primarily for better maintenance.
We refactored the code for better maintenance mainly.

cards.note: ~We refactored the code mainly for better maintaince~ is incorrect because [maintenance] or [maintainability] are the correct nouns; 'maintaince' is a misspelling.

cards.sideA: Necesito rellenar esta caja con papel.

sideB.text: I need to pad this box with paper.
I need to use paper to pad this box.
I must pad this box with paper.

cards.sideA: Él quiere rellenar su currículum.

sideB.text: He wants to pad his resume.
He is looking to pad his resume.
He wants to add some padding to his resume.

cards.sideA: Rellena a la izquierda con un cero.

sideB.text: Pad left with a zero.
It pads left with a zero.
You should pad left with a zero.

cards.sideA: Rellena a la derecha con un cero.

sideB.text: Pad right with a zero.
It pads right with a zero.
You should pad right with a zero.

cards.sideA: Agregamos la etiqueta queries para que el popup de actualización funcione.

sideB.text: We added the queries tag so the update popup works.
We included the queries tag to make the update popup functional.
We added the queries tag for the update popup to work properly.

cards.sideA: Ahora el parser de fechas soporta meses numéricos.

sideB.text: The date parser now supports numeric months.
Now the date parser handles months as numbers.
The date parser is now compatible with numeric months.

cards.sideA: Validamos el código de respuesta del backend antes de procesar los datos.

sideB.text: We validate the backend response code before processing the data.
We check the backend response code before data processing.
We verify the response code from the backend before handling the data.

cards.sideA: Las cantidades ahora se generan dinámicamente según el multiplicador.

sideB.text: Quantities are now dynamically generated based on the multiplier.
We now generate quantities dynamically according to the multiplier.
Quantities are generated dynamically based on the product multiplier.

cards.sideA: Ocultamos el selector de cantidad hasta que el producto esté cargado.

sideB.text: We hide the quantity selector until the product is loaded.
The quantity selector remains hidden until the product loads.
We keep the quantity selector hidden until the product has loaded.

cards.sideA: Eliminamos los endpoints que no eran llaves válidas del middleware.

sideB.text: We removed endpoints that weren't valid middleware keys.
We deleted the endpoints that were not valid keys in the middleware.
The endpoints that were not valid middleware keys have been removed.

cards.sideA: Añadimos una llave única para evitar errores al cambiar de idioma.

sideB.text: We added a unique key to prevent errors when changing languages.
A unique key was added to avoid issues during language transitions.
We included a unique key to stop errors when switching languages.

cards.sideA: Cambiamos el ID de cotización por el ID de línea para mayor precisión.

sideB.text: We changed the Quote ID for the Line ID for better accuracy.
We replaced the Quote ID with the Line ID for improved precision.
The Quote ID was swapped for the Line ID to increase accuracy.

cards.sideA: El controlador ahora detecta versiones forzadas desde la base de datos.

sideB.text: The controller now detects forced versions from the database.
Now the controller identifies forced versions within the database.
The controller is now able to detect forced versions from the database.

cards.sideA: Los scripts de compilación ahora inyectan las URLs de actualización automáticamente.

sideB.text: Build scripts now inject the update URLs automatically.
Now the build scripts automatically inject the update URLs.
The build scripts inject the update URLs in an automated way.

cards.sideA: Estandarizamos las etiquetas de pago en inglés y francés.

sideB.text: We standardized the payment labels in English and French.
Payment labels were standardized across English and French.
We made the payment labels consistent in English and French.

cards.sideA: Los usuarios de Saskatchewan ahora ven el mensaje de retención correcto.

sideB.text: Saskatchewan users now see the correct hold message.
Users in Saskatchewan now view the right hold message.
Now Saskatchewan users receive the correct hold message.

cards.sideA: Actualizamos el número de versión y los parámetros del upgrader.

sideB.text: We updated the version number and the upgrader parameters.
The version number and upgrader parameters have been updated.
We have updated the version number along with the upgrader parameters.

cards.sideA: Refactorizamos la consulta para incluir el factor de conversión.

sideB.text: We refactored the query to include the conversion factor.
The query was refactored to incorporate the conversion factor.
We modified the query to include the conversion rate.

cards.sideA: Deshabilitamos este archivo porque la lógica fue movida a LTO.

sideB.text: We disabled this file because the logic was moved to LTO.
This file was disabled since the logic moved to LTO.
We have disabled this file as the logic is now in LTO.
